instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.R5281: What is R5281? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
Hi, this board came in with no magsafe light. I track down the problem to <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>, and <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR>. replaced all, and magsafe green light come.
a few days later customer came back, no green light. i see ppbus is 12.2v. I have tried replacing smc 3 times.but still ppbus 12.2v and no green light. I test my smc to my sure working board and smc is good. so problem should be on board side.
i noticed <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> is low at 0.7v at <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
its not shorted, diode mode is 0.473.
so to sum up
I have ppbus 12.2v
pp3v42 : 3.4v
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> 0.7v.

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> got proper dcin 16v, acin 4v, vdd 5.1v, and vddp 4v.
any pointer ? thanks..
for info, i have replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> a few times too, and quite sure its not the isl problem.
the whole board is kinda *not corroded,but oxidized. all probe point is dark.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: diode mode on scl sda is 0.461 0.461, so good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
The machine can work without Magsafe light; even with 12.2V at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
Please post accurate information; no green light AND not turning on???

Check <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
yeah, no green light and not turning on.
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3.3v good
these machine can turn on without green light ok, but these machine doesnt turn on automatically ( it should be )

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R5087</RESISTOR> value is good, i changed it but it still pull down <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> across it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: do you mean <CHIP>U6901</CHIP> ? i removed it but <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> still low.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
Yeah <CHIP>U6901</CHIP>...

Sometime <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> drops when measure it, but no usual.
Resolder <CHIP>U6901</CHIP> and check voltage at pins 4 & 5.

Do you have continuity between <CHIP>U6901</CHIP>, <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and <RESISTOR>R5087</RESISTOR>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
continuity between <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pin 2 to <CHIP>U6901</CHIP> is like 2 ohm.
I have tried measuring connectivity between sda scl smc to <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR>, its like 1 ohm. it should be as close as possible to 0 ohm. but everything is kinda not rly 'tightly' connected. maybe the board has some kind of flexion damagE ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
i force it with 100k, but voltage is still pulled to 0.7v
I tried wire it directly, now I got green light and machine is turning on
any side effect ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
<CHIP>U5010</CHIP> can be bad now.
Never force a pull-up resistor lower than 0.47-1 Kohm.
This value will prevent a sink current higher than 3-6 mA.
Sometime 100 ohm, even direct connection, can be used, but depends where.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
wow, ok. i actually ignore <CHIP>U5010</CHIP> which have a oxidized feet because i thought <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> doesnt have anything to do with <CHIP>U5010</CHIP>, and I have pp3v42 anyway.
i replaced <CHIP>U5010</CHIP>, remove jumper and put proper <RESISTOR>R5087</RESISTOR>, and now green light and turning on.
thanks a lot man!
this should be the 'proper' way now.
care to elaborate how <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> pulled down got anything to do with <CHIP>U5010</CHIP> ?
